Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2014 04:59PM Amanda796 wrote: I have not chimed in on this thread yet, though I have been following it.  I was diagnosed back in October 2013 with extensive liver and bone mets from the start.  I am on P/H/T.  I had a scan after 3 treatments and there has been significant reduction in the liver lesions and sizable breast tumor was obliterated.  My CA27.29 went from 194 to 44.   The MO has called this a beautiful response.  The side effects have been manageable for me but I have heard others have struggled.  I had the "purge" the first couple treatments, but I just had my 5th treatment last week and this has been the least amount of side effects to date.  I too am so encouraged by those that went NED with liver mets.  I so look forward to joining those ranks.
Posts.Title: How are people with liver mets doing? blondie1 JFL
